answer:
People born before 1970 are generally assumed to have acquired immunity to measles from natural infection. However, there may be unprotected people in this age group, and those who have not had measles disease (or are unsure if they have had measles disease) should talk to their health care provider about getting vaccinated.
Immunization Nurse

However, there may be unprotected people in this age group, and those who have not had measles disease (or are unsure if they have had measles disease) should talk to their health care provider about getting vaccinated.

question: born in 1946 am I immune to measles if I never had them. I don't know if I had chicken pox or German measles.
